DOC.brief_summary: Utilizing 'minimal local analgesic concentration ( MLAC ) study ' design first determine relative potency Programmed Intermittent Epidural Bolus ( PIEB ) compare Continuous Epidural Infusion ( CEI ) secondly determine mechanism explain potential PIEB efficacy advantage .
DOC.brief_title: PIEB v CEI Labor Analgesia : An MLAC Study
DOC.detailed_description: Pregnant woman present Labor Delivery anticipate vaginal delivery identify potential participant base inclusion/exclusion criterion desire labor epidural analgesia . Once identify , interested candidate fully inform study procedure , question answer , informed consent obtain . Pregnant participant receive labor epidural upon patient 's request dose per protocol adequate analgesic level . Patients randomize 1 4 group . Either group I II Study Part A group III IV Study Part B double-blinded design . Each study part run parallel independently . Each group vary concentration bupivicaine infusion ; continuous intermittent bolus administration . In addition group continuous intermittent bolus administration sufentanil . These concentration form administration blind patient study administrator . Each epidural infusion concentration continuous bolus administration determine success failure base analgesic score . The investigator ' primary outcome minimal local anesthetic concentration final participant respective group upon study completion . DATA SAFETY MONITORING PLAN follow standard clinical care . Any adverse event report PI necessary adjustment protocol immediately institute .
DOC.criteria: ASA I & II , Nulliparous Multiparous , Spontaneous/Induced/Augmented Labor , Early active labor ( cervix < 5 cm ( know ) ) , Pain ( VPS ) > 3 , 1845 year age < 37 week gestation , H/o Cesarean Section , Multiple Gestation , Preeclampsia , Narcotics within 3 hour prior labor epidural placement , Chronic Pain ( define chronic opiate consumption ) , Women participate another study impact protocol
